intro: Earina laxior, commonly known as the slender earina, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while the stems are often hairy. Earina laxior thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
